intro: Centaurea canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Island star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring bright blue or purple flowers. The plant has spiny leaves and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flower heads. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Centaurea canariensis is sometimes considered an invasive species in regions outside its native range.
